properties.entry: Perform another action on these devices
Download CSV File Of Failed Lines
Select a set of devices to perform a bulk operation on:
Select An Action To Perform On Selected Devices:

Selecting any of these options will not immediately make any changes.
You will be directed to a page with additional options and/or opportunity to confirm your action.
Add devices to a Device Group.
Remove devices from a Device Group.
Issue a command to multiple devices.
Read an attribute of multiple devices.
Change same value on multiple devices.
Change the device type of devices.
Find route that devices respond on.
View a report detailing archived reads.
Assign a config to a collection of devices.
Send device configurations to a collection of devices.
Reads device configuration settings from the devices.
Verify settings between the device and the assigned configuration.
Choose A Device Group To Add The Selected Devices To:

Select a group then click the "Add Devices To Selected Device Group" button.
You will be redirected to the selected group within the Device Group Editor page.
Add Devices To Selected Device Group
Choose A Group To Remove The Selected Devices From:

Select a group then click the "Remove Devices From Selected Group" button.
You will be redirected to the selected group within the Device Group Editor page.
Choose The Type Of Change To Perform On Selected Devices:

Selecting any of these options will not immediatly make any changes.
You will be directed to a page with additional options specific to the type of change selected.
Select Route To Change Selected Devices To:
Choose To Enable Or Disable Selected Devices:

Progress is updated periodically. Processing will continue if you wish to navigate away from this page at any time.
You can return to this results page by following a link within the "Recent Bulk Operations" section of the main Bulk Operations page.
Choose New Operation For These Devices
Enable or Disable all of the selected devices
Select the Device Configuration you wish to assign the selected devices to.

Progress is updated periodically. Processing will continue if you wish to navigate away from this page at any time.
You can return to this results page by following a link within the "Recent Bulk Operations" section of the main Bulk Operations page.
Choose New Operation For These Devices

Select the method you wish to use when sending configurations to devices. This action will transmit configuration settings out to devices. The standard method will compare the settings of the device with the settings of the configuration and send only the unmatching fields to the device. The force method will send the entire configuration to the device.
Devices that do not support this action:
Compares the settings of the device to the settings of the configuration. This action compares database information and does not read from the device.
Reads the configuration settings from the device and updates the database information for that device.

You are about to delete {0} devices.
Use the "Delete" button below to confirm this action and perform the delete.

Progress is updated periodically. Processing will continue if you wish to navigate away from this page at any time.
You can return to this results page by following a link within the "Recent Bulk Operations" section of the main Bulk Operations page.
Choose New Operation For These Devices
Select the Device Type you wish to change selected devices to.
Results Of Change Device Type Operation

Progress is updated periodically. Processing will continue if you wish to navigate away from this page at any time.
You can return to this results page by following a link within the "Recent Bulk Operations" section of the main Bulk Operations page.
Choose New Operation For These Devices
* Masking points may take a longer time to complete when the collection contains many devices.
Click this button to mask (disable) selection of points that already exist on all of the selected devices.
Click this button to unmask (enable) selection of all supported points for each device type; this option will show all points supported even if some selected devices already have them created.
Show all supported points for each selected device type. When all selected devices are of the same type, "all points" and "shared points" will display the same set of points.
Show only those points that all selected device types support.
If the point already exists on the device, then no change will be made.
If the point already exists on the device, then its multiplier, unit of measure, and state group will be reset to the standard definition for that point.
Select at least one point to add.

Progress is updated periodically. Processing will continue if you wish to navigate away from this page at any time.
You can return to this results page by following a link within the "Recent Bulk Operations" section of the main Bulk Operations page.
Failed To Add Points To Devices
Choose New Operation For These Devices
* Masking points may take a longer time to complete when the collection contains many devices.
Mask Points That Do Not Already Exist
Click this button to mask (disable) selection of points that do not exist on all of the selected devices.
Click this button to unmask (enable) selection of all supported points for each device type; this option will show all points supported even if some selected devices do not have them created.
Show all supported points for each selected device type. When all selected devices are of the same type, "all points" and "shared points" will display the same set of points.
Show only those points that all selected device types support.
Select at least one point to update.
Value must be a valid decimal number.
Value must be a number greater than zero.
Value must be a valid integer number.

Progress is updated periodically. Processing will continue if you wish to navigate away from this page at any time.
You can return to this results page by following a link within the "Recent Bulk Operations" section of the main Bulk Operations page.
Choose New Operation For These Devices
* Masking points may take a a little longer when working with a collection containg many devices.
Mask Points That No Devices Have
Click the button to mask those points that none of the selected devices currently have.
Click the button to view all supported points for each device type will be shown, even if noneof the selected devices currently have the point.
Show all points for each device type. When all selected devices are of the same type, "all points" and "shared points" will be the same set of points.
Show only those points that all of the selected devices support.
Select at least one point to remove.

Progress is updated periodically. Processing will continue if you wish to navigate away from this page at any time.
You can return to this results page by following a link within the "Recent Bulk Operations" section of the main Bulk Operations page.
Failed To Remove Points From Devices
Choose New Operation For These Devices
Upload a CSV formatted file containing column headers for fields you want to update:

Uploading a file will not immediatly make any changes.
You will be directed to a page with additional options and/or opportunity to confirm.

• Files must contain a header row with valid column identifiers as listed in the table below.

  • The first column is always the Identifier Column.
    It will be used to determine which device is to be updated.

  • One of the following column identifiers must be used in the Identifier Column:
    ADDRESS, METER_NUMBER, NAME, or DEVICE_ID.

  • Leaving a field blank indicates that the field should not be changed.
    Chosen columns should be included for each row even if they contain no value.

Address of disconnect collar for device.
Supported by MCT-410 type devices only.
Leave blank to remove existing disconnect address.
Use "true", "yes", or "on" to enable, "false", "no", or "off" to disable. Case-insensitive. Invalid values are ignored.
Name of route to change to.
Invalid route names will not cause a change.
Device type will not change if type chosen type is not valid for the device.
Internal system ID for the device.
Cannot be updated, use only as an identifier column.
Serial Number of the RFN Meter.
File should contain at least one update column.
Non-identifier field in first column header.
Could not find device for {0} identifier: {1}
Value "{0}" is not applicable for {1} identifier: {2}
Confirm you wish to perform the following update:

Progress is updated periodically. Processing will continue if you wish to navigate away from this page at any time.
You can return to this results page by following a link within the "Recent Bulk Operations" section of the main Bulk Operations page.
Choose New Operation For These Devices
Upload a CSV formatted file containing required column headers for creating a new device, and additional attributes you want to setup:

Uploading a file will not immediatly create any devices.
You will be directed to a page with additional options and/or opportunity to confirm.

• Files must contain a header row with valid columns as listed in the tables below.

  • Devices may be imported using either by Template or by Device Type.
    Each method requires that certain column values are included for each row.

  • Additional columns may be included to further configure the device.
New Devices will be created based on existing devices.
New devices will be created based on a Device Type.
Used as basis for new device.
New device will be of this type.
Address of disconnect collar to set.

Use "true", "yes", or "on" to enable, "false", "no", or "off" to disable.
Case-insensitive. Invalid values are ignored.
Invalid route names will not be set.
Serial Number of the RFN Meter.

File must contain all of the required fields.
Check that the file is CSV formatted.
Column can not be used as identifier: {0}
